ACT
143
The right of co-heirs who lived or did business together with the testator
At the request of a co-heir who lived or did business together with the decedent, as well as the recorder , the court may, when a justified need requires it, decide to leave certain things, movable or immovable, or groups of things, which would have belonged to other heirs. , and that he pays them the value of those things in money within a period determined by the court according to the circumstances. The decision of the court granting that request is an enforceable document.
A co-heir who is a farmer does not have to make probable the justified need referred to in paragraph 1 of this article when it comes to inheriting agricultural land and things used for performing agricultural activities.
For the sum determined in this way, the persons referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article have a legal lien on the parts of the estate allocated to the heir to secure the amount that is owed to them until payment.
If they are not paid within the deadline, they have the right to demand payment of their claim or hand over things that would otherwise belong to them in the name of the inherited part.
